result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Jeffrey Matthaeus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all costs and surcharges by the end of probation.  If revoked, to be collected by DOC from out of up to 25% of prison funds.  Any balance as a condition of probation.  if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
*Court ordered no DNA sample or DNA surcharge as this case predates the April 1, 2015 change in law.
Seek and maintain ful time employment.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with Eve's jewelry.

Cognitive Behavior Therapy. 
Contact with Teresa M. at the probation agent's discretion.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens. No positive results.

timeConds.notes: Forthwith.  Huber privileges for work, school, tretament and Day Reporting Center.  The Court does not object to electronic monitoring.

records.addlTxt:
Order, signed and filed.
The defendant's motion or request for additional release privileges is DENIED.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for release to DRC after revocation of probation.

Order for Cancellation of Huber/work release/electronic surveillance privileges.  The privileges previously granted are cancelled, and the defendant is sentenced to ordinary confinement for the balance of the term heretofore imposed, filed and signed by the Court.  Copies forwarded to parties.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Pocan Br 26 for review. os
Decision and Order Denying Request for Good Time filed and signed by the Court.  Copies forwarded to parties.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, the request filed on 7/13/2015 is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. crt
Defendant's pro se request for good time.

Defendant Robert Jeffrey Matthaeus in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Robert Jeffrey Matthaeus in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 2 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment. 

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  

The court STAYED the sentence on both counts and placed the defendant on probation for a period of  2 years with the following conditions:

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
*As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 135 days in the House of Correction.  Huber privileges for work, school, treatment and Day Reporting Center.  The Court does not object to electronic  monitoring.  FORTHWITH.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with Eve's Jewelry.
*Contact with Teresa M. at the probation agent's discretion
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered no DNA sample or DNA surcharge, as this case pre-dates the April 1, 2015 change in law.
- Pay all costs and surcharges by the end of probation, if revoked, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court lifts stayed warrant.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered no bail forfeited at this time.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter in court to address Justice Point Violation.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 8:30 for Sentencing.
Email to Attorney Jamie Cimpl-Wiemer to schedule bail/bond hearing to address Justice Point violation.  Scheduled June 26, 2015 at 8:30 am.
JusticePoint Violation Report received and filed.

COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-01-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert Jeffrey Matthaeus in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed.  
  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Theft, (Value Not Exceeding $2,.500.00), PTAC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), 939.51(3)(a), 939.05,  Class A misdemeanors.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Robert Jeffrey Matthaeus in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case pending new plea negotiations.  On joint motion of parties, court ordered jury trial converted to plea hearing date.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert Jeffrey Matthaeus in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  James C. Griffin appeared for Tyrone Martin St. Junior for the State of Wisconsin. Court admonished the Defendant. Case adjourned for a Final Pretrial Hearing in Branch 26 on 05-08-2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court. 

*** Court makes findings that there is a possible victim identified therefore recompense is an issue.  Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.***
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Robert Jeffrey Matthaeus in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury trial scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert Jeffrey Matthaeus in court with attorney Calvin Malone for Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Brandon Wigley for Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
